text: The Ven. Walter Thomas was a Church of Ireland priest in the first half of the 18th century.Handbook of British Chronology By Fryde, E. B;. Greenway, D.E;Porter, S; Roy, I: Cambridge, CUP, 1996 , 0713642556 == Biography == Walter Thomas was born in Athlone and educated at Trinity College there."Alumni Dublinenses : a register of the students, graduates, professors and provosts of Trinity College in the University of Dublin (1593–1860)" George Dames Burtchaell/Thomas Ulick Sadleir p807: Dublin, Alex Thom and Co, 1935 He was Archdeacon of Killaloe from 1714 to 1715. He may be the same Walter Thomas who was Precentor of Cashel from 1715 to 1720; then Treasurer of Cashel from 1721 until his resignation on 16 April 1737, and for many years Rector of Thurles. His son George was Treasurer of Cashel from 1737 to 1768.Newport History Society He also involved himself with the political, social, and religious issues of his time. On 18 September 1727 he informed William Smyth that John Allen was going to vote for Robert French and John King, and thus get over his engagement to Lowther. The same year, he opposed Benjamin Holme at a Quakers Meeting held in Thurles. He died in June 1743. ==Citations== ==Sources== * * * * Category:17th-century births Category:1743 deaths Category:Archdeacons of Killaloe Category:18th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin Category:People from Athlone
title: Walter Thomas (priest)
